wikipedia_page.main: James R Ford is a contemporary British conceptual artist.

response: *Contemporary artist James Robert Ford grew up in Yateley and attended Yateley School. A number of his projects, including House Gymnastics, General Carbuncle, and 33 Things to do before you're 10, have taken place in Yateley.
*James Robert Ford (born 1980), British web and installation artist
House Gymnastics is a sport created by James Robert Ford and Spencer Harrison.

British artist James Robert Ford started a Twitter-specific art project in 2009 entitled A Tweet a Day. He tweets one word a day from Tove Jansson's The Moomin Who Believed in Disasters via Twitter user account @JamesRFord.https://www.twitter.com/JamesRFord  The story recital is expected to finish in 2021. According to Ford, retelling of a child's short story through the microblogging service Twitter emphasises the distribution and delocation of experience.

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with Goldsmiths, University of London

response: Following her death, the Tui McLauchlan Art Award Trust established the Tui McLauchlan Emerging Artist Award with the aim of furthering the reach and impact of emerging artists. Winners have included: James Robert Ford (2013); Yona Lee (2014).
